reviews.review_msg: David is a very fun loving professor, but he is really unclear with his responses. He does not give proper feedback at all. He is a really unpredictable professor. I had a very hard time with his expectations from the assignments. Would recommend a big no for him.

Dr. Matijasevich is by far the greatest professor I have had at Cap. He engages the class frequently and likes to ask the class questions and get their opinions on subjects, all while listening intently and giving insightful feedback. If you want to learn about politics he's your guy, makes it extremely fun and engaging.

David is super nice and a good teacher. He enjoys student participation and engages with all students questions and comments in a very open and genuine way which helps with student engagement in the coursework. He is also very knowledgeable and passionate about the political landscape in Southeast Asia and has interesting insight in this area.

David is a great guy! Ive only had him for a few classes but i can already tell he cares about his students. Classes are mandatory (but hes flexible with missing classes cause he has recorded lectures), his assignments are fair and actually help you learn a lot more by reading and researching for yourself as well. 10/10 funny guy, love the class!
